column4: it's basically historic.  ia64 was given to itanium processors before there was an x86-64.  AMD had the first x86-64bit processors, and the name kinda stuck as AMD64 to differentiate between itanium.
Î™ understand, but I believe it should be clearer
lots of stuff should be clearer.  If you change the name now after this long, lots of stuff will be less clear
amd basically "invented" the 64bit architecture for the x86 line of chips (or at least were the fist to have one), I don't think it's wrong to reflect that in the name
